nodes.bodyText:
please explain what these flags do.
Which functionality of the commonservice is dependent on this flag?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -18,4 +18,6 @@ server.servlet.context-path=/audit-log-service
 spring.datasource.initialize=false
 
 # other app configurations
-auditlog.platform-version=1.0
\ No newline at end of file
+auditlog.platform-version=1.0
+commonservice.auditlogevent.enabled=false
+commonservice.email.enabled=false

nodes.bodyText: common-service contains many re-usable components, email service is one such component. This email service is not required by all other services, so to avoid unnecessarily adding configurations for email, this email service component is conditionally loaded by the spring boot. Same reason applies to AuditLogEvent services/repos/entities. Reusable entities should be loaded conditionally to avoid creating the tables when spring.jpa.hibernate.ddl-auto=update
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -18,4 +18,6 @@ server.servlet.context-path=/audit-log-service
 spring.datasource.initialize=false
 
 # other app configurations
-auditlog.platform-version=1.0
\ No newline at end of file
+auditlog.platform-version=1.0
+commonservice.auditlogevent.enabled=false
+commonservice.email.enabled=false

nodes.bodyText: Test should not have dependency on one another.
We are using @Order only in integration tests. IMO, we can use @Order for integration tests but not in unit tests. I also checked SO post and Your tests shall not be ordered (shall they?)
addressed below. Please create a bug for this effort so that it will get addressed later.
I received similar comments on PR #664 so I removed @Order from all the tests in PR #664 .  PR 664 has been approved.
please remove ordering, instead you can clean up the matching event from the logs.
We are using @Order only in integration tests. IMO, we can use @Order for integration tests but not in unit tests. I also checked SO post and Your tests shall not be ordered (shall they?)
I received similar comments on PR #664 so I removed @order from all the tests in PR #664 . PR 664 has been approved.
rename to something more descriptive, e.g. auditRequest
Renamed to auditRequest
this is not PII, we don't need to exclude it form logs.
Removed @ToString.Exclude for systemIp
This field has been removed in new audit log requirements.
If I recall correctly we had agreed to remove OrgID entirely, so there is no point in adding it here.
I'll check with Shanthala and fix this issue #628 in follow up PR.
I've removed OrgId from audit log implementation in this PR and from other places in PR #650 .
system IP to be removed
I'll check with Shanthala and fix this issue #628 in follow up PR.
I've removed System IP field
where is this used and why is cookie not encrypted?
cookies are used in login/consent flow, these cookie information doesn't contain PII/PHI data. This is a reusable code for preparing audit event requests.
let's postpone this until we have a decision with regard to the fallback and retry approach.
Added your comment to issue #628 to fix in followup PR.
Fallback related code has been removed in PR #592
please rename to auditRequest
I'll stop using acronyms for variable names in future PR's. Renamed to auditRequest
isSuccessful is probably descriptive enough, is2xx is an implementation detail.

please rename all aleRequest and aleResponses to auditRequest and auditRepsponse.
ale will be quite confusing to new users.
I replaced all aleRequest with auditRequest in the workspace.
please remove all versioning instances from this code and other dependent PRs
Added this comment to issue #628, it'll be removed in follow up PR.
nit: would be nice to extract common header in one file and reuse them
Created a CommonConstants class in common-service with this variable. We'll re-use this class for other common constants.

Unit tests should be independent of one another; having these dependency on previous tests means that if one of the early tests fails, all following tests will also fail which is misleading and can hide other potential failures.
Please fix and remove @order from all unit tests.
We are using @Order only in integration tests. IMO, we can use @Order for integration tests but not in unit tests. I also checked SO post and Your tests shall not be ordered (shall they?)

I would prefer to have isolated tests for both unit and integration tests.
Otherwise as I said, a failure in an earlier test would cause all following tests to also fail.
Also if you remove the dependencies, we could in future speed the tests up by making them run in parallel.
I received similar comments on PR #664 so I removed @order from all the tests in PR #664 . PR 664 has been approved.
this will removed as well.
We don't need these values at all; the final decision was to use a human readable enum field to identify each of these components.
I've created new enums as per new audit log requirements. Kindly review.

there is not a lot of value in constants that equal their own value. A better approach would be to name the constant as to what it is, similar to how a variable is named, and its value should be the content for your environment, class, etc.
If values are possible values for the same thing that can be used by the application, you have an enum hiding in your class.
Repeated string values extracted to constants to fix SonarLint issues, replaced Constants class with eum.
We are removing event names. Event code should be sufficient.
Removed eventName field
event_id is sufficient. This should be removed. Please refer to the Audit log columns doc for the final list of fields.
Removed eventName field

let's not implement this for now.
Versioning is something that we have not discussed yet, we briefly talked about it a few months ago and decided to consider the whole platform as a connected entity and return the same fixed version for all until we have had the chance to revisit the API between the components.
So for here, let's return a single version for now. i.e. "application.version" works for now.
Replaced with application.version

description is also redundant for this event, since the action is taken by the same user and so the user_id field would point to the same user.
If description text is redundant, then it should not be skipped. Introducing free form text in the audit log, increases the chance of accidentally leaking PII and PHI, so I would like to limit that to events that absolutely need this information.
please remove event name from the code entirely. EventCode field should be descriptive enough.
Removed eventName  from this enum

I don't see the value of creating these event enums, Can you explain why you are creating them in advance and not calling a generic submit event method in the code itself?
also what happens if we integrated WCP or other mobile apps with the auth server. Do you expect to have a separate PASSWORD_RESET_SUCCESS event for each source component?
ok, that sounds good.
please change the text for "unknown" to "Any other value. Should not happen"

+      "MOBILE APPS", "The iOS and Android apps that participants use to interact with MyStudies"),
+
+  RESPONSE_DATASTORE(
+      "RESPONSE DATASTORE",
+      "The back-end components that manage participant response data (does not include PII) "),
+
+  PARTICIPANT_DATASTORE(
+      "PARTICIPANT DATASTORE",
+      "The back-end components that manage app user / study participant data (includes PII)"),
+
+  STUDY_BUILDER("STUDY BUILDER", "The UI that researchers use to design and deploy studies"),
+
+  STUDY_DATASTORE(
+      "STUDY DATASTORE",
+      "This is the back-end component that manages the study builder data and holds the study configurations"),
+
+  SCIM_AUTH_SERVER(
+      "SCIM AUTH SERVER",
+      "This component implements login/consent flow and integrates with ORY Hydra for access and refresh tokens"),
+
+  AUTH_SERVER(
+      "Auth Server",
+      "This is back-end component that manages user accounts and issues access and refresh tokens"),
+
+  PARTICIPANT_MANAGER(

+      "The UI that administrators use to invite participants to studies and track enrollment progress"),
+
+  CLOUD_STORAGE(

nodes.bodyText: Cloud Storage was not in FDA MyStudies nomeclature. I removed it and then added it back from commit history. I fixed the review comment.
